pull.title: Add warnings to createmultisig and addmultisig if using uncompressed keys
pull.body:
Fixes #21368

Currently, if there are any uncompressed keys when calling `AddAndGetMultisigDestination`, it will just default to a legacy address regardless of the chosen `address_type`. Rather than keeping this silent behaviour which may be confusing to users, we explicitly add a `warnings` field which will warn the user why their address format is different.

events.body: Feedback addressed in new commit, which ensures the warning message is only returned if an address type is explicitly chosen by the user. Also adds the test @instagibbs requested.
@meshcollider does it make sense to fail instead?
@promag I don't think so personally, a warning is sufficient IMO.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.

events.message: Add warnings field to createmultisig to warn about uncompressed keys
Add warnings field to addmultisigaddress to warn about uncompressed keys
Add createmultisig and addmultisigaddress warnings release note

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -103,6 +103,7 @@ static RPCHelpMan createmultisig()
                         {RPCResult::Type::STR, "address", "The value of the new multisig address."},
                         {RPCResult::Type::STR_HEX, "redeemScript", "The string value of the hex-encoded redemption script."},
                         {RPCResult::Type::STR, "descriptor", "The descriptor for this multisig"},
+                        {RPCResult::Type::STR, "warnings", "Any warnings resulting from the creation of this multisig"},
comments.body: I think it would make sense to make warnings an array of strings.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -103,6 +103,7 @@ static RPCHelpMan createmultisig()
                         {RPCResult::Type::STR, "address", "The value of the new multisig address."},
                         {RPCResult::Type::STR_HEX, "redeemScript", "The string value of the hex-encoded redemption script."},
                         {RPCResult::Type::STR, "descriptor", "The descriptor for this multisig"},
+                        {RPCResult::Type::STR, "warnings", "Any warnings resulting from the creation of this multisig"},
comments.body: Can do, although this is in-line with how other RPCs return warnings.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -103,6 +103,7 @@ static RPCHelpMan createmultisig()
                         {RPCResult::Type::STR, "address", "The value of the new multisig address."},
                         {RPCResult::Type::STR_HEX, "redeemScript", "The string value of the hex-encoded redemption script."},
                         {RPCResult::Type::STR, "descriptor", "The descriptor for this multisig"},
+                        {RPCResult::Type::STR, "warnings", "Any warnings resulting from the creation of this multisig"},
comments.body: Warnings array is also preferable to me. There are a few other RPCs which return warnings array, and I think we should move to doing that more.

comments.body: Might check `!request.params[2].isNull()` here too, in case a future PR changes the default address type?
also assert that there's no error in the good case
